2021/02 - 2021/09.description: After positive past work experience for this job, decided to take it up again for the next semester. Responsible for all projects and practical learning experiences. Mainly teach about low-level C network protocol construction and transmission encodings.

2020/02 - 2020/09.description: Hired by Head of Systems Research Department after obtaining excellent project results when participating in this course as a student. Responsible for all projects and practical learning experiences.

2018/09 - 2019/02.description: My first job in Computer Science-related fields. Job offered by professor due to displayed skills when following this course as a student. Involved mainly in offensive strategies projects.

2019/09 - 2021/08.name: Master of Science - Computer Science
2019/09 - 2021/08.description:
After a nominal 5 years (3 BSc and 2 MSc), I finally got my MSc title in Computer Science & Advanced Data Analytics, the Advanced Computing and Systems track.

I completed my studies with an average grade of 9.5/10, finishing at the absolute top of my year, with multiple publications to my name.
For these achievements, Leiden University offered me a PhD position to continue my research.
This is an exceptional honor for me.

My dissertation for this study was about computation offloading in distributed systems, in an international collaboration with the University of California, Santa Cruz and the Institute for Research and Innovation in Software for High Energy Physics (IRIS-HEP).

2017/09 - 2018/02.name: Secretary of Commision
2017/09 - 2018/02.description: Helped organize many introductory activities for new students, such as a casino night, a Wie is de Mol? (English: Who is the Mole?) event, and the very last full-scale LAN party ever organized in the LIACS faculty building.

2017/01 - 2017/05.name: Chairman of Committee
2017/01 - 2017/05.description: Organized the yearly 'Parent-day' event, where beginning students are invited with their parents/family to interact with lecturers and professors, and have a tour of the faculty. The best moment for parents to get insights into the academic life of their studying children, and have a fun and interesting day.
